p: The marine Jurassic of the Sundance Seaway comprises eight main unconformity‐bounded depositional sequences (Fig. 2). Each is named for its underlying sequence boundary, which corresponds in most cases to a previously recognized regional unconformity defined by a chert‐pebble horizon (Fig. 2; Pipiringos 1968; Pipiringos & O'Sullivan 1978; Parcell & Williams 2005; McMullen et al. 2014; Clement & Holland 2016). We have correlated these unconformity‐bounded depositional sequences across Wyoming and into the Twin Creek Formation, resulting in a regional sequence stratigraphical framework.
